content.description: Over-hung route that pumps you out. Heal hooks are essential along with good pull strength.
content.protection: Two pads and an active spotter.
content.location: Start on juggy flat hold underneath the roof. Feet are pushing you back on as you move your hands up. Jugs almost all the way up but getting out of the roof is a little difficult along with the top out.

content.description: Big rock with overhang on the West side VERY chossy, but just needs more climbing to fix that. Some of the rock is sharp just like all of South Mountain. It is about 25 feet tall, and the down-climb is very easy. The hardest part is topping out since there is not a great fall zone.
